channel.title: Web3 Security Paper Digest
channel.description: Curated papers on Web3, blockchain, and smart contract security from ArXiv and ACL

item.title: TxRay: Agentic Postmortem of Live Blockchain Attacks
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces TxRay, an LLM-driven agentic system that reconstructs Anyone-Can-Take (ACT) DeFi attacks from one or more seed transactions, recovers exploit lifecycle and derives evidence-backed root causes.
  • Generates runnable, self-contained Proofs-of-Concept (PoCs) with semantic oracles (executable assertions) to deterministically reproduce incidents and self-check postmortems.
  • Evaluated on 114 incidents (DeFiHackLabs): 92.11% end-to-end reproduction, 98.1% of PoCs avoid hard-coded attacker addresses; median delivery times of validated root causes in 40 minutes and PoCs in 59 minutes; outperforms prior tools (STING, APE).
  • Includes PoCEvaluator, an independent agentic execution-and-review evaluator for correctness and quality assessment of generated PoCs.

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Ziyue Wang', 'Jiangshan Yu', 'Kaihua Qin', 'Dawn Song', 'Arthur Gervais', 'Liyi Zhou']
  • Tags: ['DeFi', 'smart-contract-security', 'exploit-analysis', 'automated-auditing', 'postmortem-forensics']
